instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.message: What is the resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?  <RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R6996</RESISTOR> good?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light Dark
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 6,3 ohms

<RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR> 127,3 ohms
<RESISTOR>R6996</RESISTOR> 127,3 ohms

if I remove resistance <RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR> ou of circut 348K and <RESISTOR>R6996</RESISTOR> 200K out of circut

same value with another donnor

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light Dark
threads.message: Remove L6995 and check which pin is shorted.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light Dark
threads.message:
removed L6995 short to gnd pin 2 <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> :/ 

what do I have to do ? inject voltage in <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> ?

threads.message: Resistance to GND on Y2810? If lower then 10Mega Ohm your MCP is fried.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light Dark
threads.message:
Pin 4 of Y2810 to GND 7,2 Mohms
Pin 1 7,20 ohms

Does that mean the MCP is dead ?

I have new chip but A2, in board it's A3

(on Mac mini 2010 succeful MCP89MZ-A2 to MCP89MZ-A3 but in the other direction probably work ?)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light Dark
threads.message: MCP is dead to start with. I doubt the chips are new, reballed garbage that are likely dead too. A2 and A3 versions are compatible.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light Dark
threads.message:
Solved after replaced MCP no short to gnd PP3V42, replaced bad fuse for backlight and ISL destroyed by customer (ppbus low). (display port not work fuck)

Thank you I would not find that this comes from MCP
